title: can't figure out how to use --with-data for publish
body:
Not sure what 'shell pattern' really should be since doesn't allow to specify a directory ('.'), glob ('*')... clearly demanding to specify all files one by one wouldn't scale...  so it should at least allow the globs and '.' dirs... but 

```
$> datalad publish --with-data=. neurosmaug
usage: datalad publish [--version] [-h]
                       [-l {critical,error,warning,info,debug,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9}]
                       [-p {condor}] [-d DATASET]
                       [--with-data [WITH_DATA [WITH_DATA ...]]] [-r]
                       [dest] [path [path ...]]
datalad publish: error: argument --with-data: invalid constraint:(list(basestring) or None) value: '.'

$> datalad publish --with-data . neurosmaug
usage: datalad publish [--version] [-h]
                       [-l {critical,error,warning,info,debug,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9}]
                       [-p {condor}] [-d DATASET]
                       [--with-data [WITH_DATA [WITH_DATA ...]]] [-r]
                       [dest] [path [path ...]]
datalad publish: error: argument --with-data: invalid constraint:(list(basestring) or None) value: '.'

$> datalad publish --with-data '*' neurosmaug
usage: datalad publish [--version] [-h]
                       [-l {critical,error,warning,info,debug,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9}]
                       [-p {condor}] [-d DATASET]
                       [--with-data [WITH_DATA [WITH_DATA ...]]] [-r]
                       [dest] [path [path ...]]
datalad publish: error: argument --with-data: invalid constraint:(list(basestring) or None) value: '*'

$> datalad publish --help | grep -A4 -e '--with-data'
                       [--with-data [WITH_DATA [WITH_DATA ...]]] [-r]
                       [dest] [path [path ...]]

publish a handle.

  --with-data [WITH_DATA [WITH_DATA ...]]
                        shell pattern. Constraints: value must be convertible
                        to list(basestring). [Default: None]
```

so later I understood that I need to provide path as argument but still not sure what I really need to specify to with-data so it just 'git annex copy' all files to the remote:

```
$> datalad publish --with-data='*' neurosmaug .
usage: datalad publish [--version] [-h]
                       [-l {critical,error,warning,info,debug,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9}]
                       [-p {condor}] [-d DATASET]
                       [--with-data [WITH_DATA [WITH_DATA ...]]] [-r]
                       [dest] [path [path ...]]
datalad publish: error: argument --with-data: invalid constraint:(list(basestring) or None) value: '*'

$> datalad publish --with-data= neurosmaug . 
2016-06-15 15:32:21,891 [INFO   ] Publishing /home/yoh/deb/tarballs (publish.py:127)
ECDSA host key for IP address '129.170.233.9' not in list of known hosts.
2016-06-15 15:32:22,297 [ERROR  ] Failed to start ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'annex', 'copy', [], '--to', 'neurosmaug']'': coercing to Unicode: need string or buffer, list found [subprocess.py:_execute_child:1340] (cmd.py:261)
2016-06-15 15:32:22,298 [ERROR  ] coercing to Unicode: need string or buffer, list found [subprocess.py:_execute_child:1340] (TypeError) (main.py:242)
```
